title: October 2 protests in France: Demonstrators feel disheartened but refuse to give up
subhead: The French Interior Ministry said 195,000 people took to the streets nationwide on Thursday, October 2, compared with 505,000 on September 18. Among those protesting, bitterness prevailed over resignation.

title: In Argentina, Milei faces a new setback as Congress overturns spending vetoes
subhead: The vote comes as the US-backed Milei struggles to end a run on the national currency, the peso, in the run-up to the crucial October 26 mid-term elections.

title: Yohji Yamamoto, the wise warrior of fashion
subhead: For more than four decades, the Japanese fashion designer has continued to surprise with his radical creations. His austere and rebellious style appeals to a new generation of fans, including stars such as Offset, A$AP Rocky and Burna Boy. At 81, the tireless designer will unveil his new women's collection during Paris Fashion Week, on October 3.

title: The EU is underestimating the destruction of its natural areas
subhead: As environmental policy faces setbacks across Europe, the 'Green to Grey' investigation reveals that European land take is far higher than the official figures reported by EU authorities.
byline: Léopold Salzenstein (Arena for Journalism in Europe) and  Raphaëlle Aubert
